title: Russian ambassador gives press conference: Politics live blog | Politics | The Guardian
summary: russian ambassador 's press conference - snap summary .
green party calls for a £ 21bn wealth tax on wealthiest 1 %

documents.title: afternoon summary
text: alexander yakovenko , the russian ambassador to the uk , has said that sanctions against russia will trigger a global crisis .
he made the claim at a defiant press conference where he insisted that russia was not to blame for the shooting down of flight mh17 .
a few words about the western sanctions against russia .
first of all , we believe they are illegal , unreasonable and counter-productive .
they have nothing to do with the national interests of the countries concerned , including america .
in my view , the sectoral sanctions against russia will trigger the long-anticipated endgame of the present global crisis .
he said that , if western countries imposed further sanctions , that would show that they were engaged in a cover-up .
russia does n't supply weapons to local de facto [ separatist ] authorities in eastern ukraine .
no evidence whatsoever has been presented that the russian government has been doing this .

needless to say , we will consider any further sanctions against us and the measures of political pressure as the clear evidence that our western partners can not substantiate their allegations and [ are ] eager to engage in a cover-up of the true causes of the mh17 tragedy .
he also said there was evidence suggesting that the attack on mh17 was `` something that was aimed as framing up russia on the eve of the eu ministerial [ meeting ] that went terribly wrong . ''
the full text of yakovenko 's opening statement is here..

ministers have said local communities could be paid over £ 40m by government for simply considering the building of an underground nuclear waste disposal facility in their area.. michael fallon , the new defence secretary , blocked an attempt to make the red arrows trail the colours of the scottish flag at the commonwealth games , it has been reported .
in an interesting post btl , thegrimsqueaker says there are technical reasons that make this doubtful .
that 's all from me for today .
and for the next five weeks .
i 'm not expecting to be writing a live blog again until monday 1 september .
i 'm on holiday for some of that time and , although i will be back in august , i 'll just be doing normal news stories ( unless anything particular big crops up that merits a live blog ) .
but we will be running the readers ' edition during the summer .
if i 'm not here to launch it , my colleague carmen fishwick will be setting it up .
if there 's a problem , email her on carmen.fishwick @ theguardian.com , or contact her on twitter on @ twitterid .
have a great summer everyone .
as usual , channel 4 news 's michael crick has a good eye for hypocrisy .
michael crick ( @ michaellcrick ) russian ambassador : `` press should be free to work everywhere . ''
his staff then stop us filming flag outside embassy

documents.title: russian ambassador 's press conference - snap summary
text: here are the main points from the press conference from alexander yakovenko , the russian ambassador to london.. yakovenko said sanctions against russia were `` illegal , unreasonable and counterproductive '' and that they would make the global crisis worse..
he said that russia did not supply the rebels in eastern ukraine with weapons .
it only provided them with humanitarian assistance , he said..
he said it would be easy for the rebels to get weapons from elsewhere because ukraine was full of weapons..
he said attempts by american and ukraine to blame russia were flawed .
they were based on what appeared on social media , not proper evidence , he said .
he said at a recent intelligence briefing in america officials actually admitted there was no firm evidence to show russia was to blame..
he said russia wanted a full investigation into the crash , and that there was a case for the united nations taking action to secure the crash site..
he said the rebels looked after the crash site `` with utmost efficiency '' ..
he said russian journalist were being harassed by the ukrainian authorities..
he suggested that the government 's decision to hold an inquiry into the death of alexander litvinenko was deliberate retaliation .
the time was a `` strange '' coincidence , he said..
he challenged the british government to present all its evidence about the death of litvinenko in public .
if it insisted on giving it in private , russia would not believe it..
he criticised the european bank for reconstruction and development 's decision not to back investments in russia .
it should not be used politically in this way , he said .
news have given up their coverage of the russian ambassador 's press conference , but it still seems to be carrying on .
frank gardner ( @ frankrgardner ) russian ambassador to uk : `` britain is most hostile country in europe on visas for russians '' .
q : have you definitely ruled out the pro-russian separatists being to blame ?
yakovenko says we should wait for the evidence .
evidence from the flight recorder should be available tomorrow .
q ; you obviously think the ukrainians are to blame .
do you have any evidence for that ?
yakovenko says the russians want a full investigation .
today we have allegations and speculation .
the media are drawing their own conclusions without any facts .
q : will russians leave london if tougher sanctions are imposed ?
yakovenko says he does not know .
he hopes britain obeys the law .
britain is a place where the rule of law applies .
q : what do you think of the fact there are so many russian oligarchs in london , and that they are threatened with sanctions ?
and what if roman abramovich is targeted ?
yakovenko says russians can live where they like .
but he does not like the idea of sanctions against inviduals .
these people are here to do business .
q : and what about the fact that these people give money to the conservatives ?
yakovenko says he does not know about that .
that 's a matter for the conservatives ?
q : and what about the person playing tennis with cameron ?
is she a friend of putin 's ?
yakovenko says he would like to think that all russians are friends of the russian governments .
yakovenko is now taking questions .
q : you say russia does not give evidence to the separatists .
if so , where did they get surface to air missiles from ?
there is no evidence russia supplied the weapons , he says .
and ukraine is swarming with weapons .
to blame russia is unacceptable .
yakovenko turns to the alexander litvinenko case .
russia is the most interested party in this case , he says .
russia asked the british government to reveal the evidence it has .
but it is refused .
now it is suggested that it may give evidence to the inquiry in private .
but russia will not accept evidence provided in private .
yakovenko turns to the eu 's association agreement with ukraine .
it took the eu three months to acknowlege that russia has a legitimate interest in ukraine , he says .
he turns to western sanctions against russia .
we believe they are illegal , unreasonable and counter-productive .
they are not in the us interest , he says .
and they could trigger a global crisis , he says .
yakovenko says russia was blamed conveniently ahead of a crucial eu meeting .
but russia was the first country to call for an independent investigation , he says .
he says president putin has been keeping in close touch with eu leaders .
the crash investigation has been carried out efficiently , given the constraints of the civil war .
maybe the area should be sealed off under the aus of the united nations , he says .
he says any further sanctions against russia will be taken as proof that western countries can not substantiate their allegations , and that they are engaged in a cover up .
yakovenko now turns to the shooting down of mh17 .
there are two contradicting narratives .
washington and kiev pushing one theory blaming the rebels .
but there is no evidence for this , he says .
recently this has become more qualified .
the british media recently reported that a private briefing in washington admitted that there was no evidence to prove their case .
american intelligence could only say it had satellite evidence that the plane was shot down by a missile , he says .
it is worth asking how the russians were supposed to control the kind of people who would shoot down an airliner .
this narrative `` does not hold water '' , he says .
for example , how does it explain the action of ukrainian air traffic controllers ?
a ukrainian jet flew close to the airliner .
an article in the ft today talks about how the us fights to control the mh17 narrative .
it is striking how much washington relies on social media , he says .
yakovenko says russia does not supply weapons to the rebels in eastern ukraine .
what it does provide is humanitarian assistance , he says .

documents.title: russian ambassador 's press conference
text: the russian ambassador to the uk , alexander yakovenko , is giving a press conference now .
he started by condemning the decision to stop the european bank for reconstruction and development approving investments in russia .
it should not be used to political purposes , he says .
he is not criticising urkaine for obstructing the work of journalists .
ben kirby ( @ ben kirby ) live press conference now with russian ambo to uk @ twitterid yakovenko - he will be taking questions
more from the ukip reshuffle .
this is from the party 's news release .

south east mep diane james has been appointed as justice and home affairs spokesman , whilst yorkshire mep jane collins will take on the employment portfolio , with fellow yorkshire mep amjad bashir becoming communities spokesman .
margot parker , mep for the east midlands will be spokesman for small business .
rounding off this round of appointments , south east mep ray finch will be ukip 's fisheries spokesman .
here 's an afternoon reading list.. mehdi hassan profile justine thornton , ed miliband 's wife , for huffington post .
at a recent summer drinks party for high-profile labour supporters , it was n't ed miliband 's speech that wowed the crowd .
it was his wife 's .
`` i am trying to change the world through the law , '' justine thornton , aka mrs miliband , told the assembled luminaries in the sun-lit courtyard of mary ward house in central london .

her speech was a combination of charming tributes to her husband , passionate declamations on the need to change the way politics is conducted and , of course , the obligatory , self-deprecating anecdotes about life as a political leader 's wife .

thornton , a cambridge-educated barrister , told an amusing story about how she and her husband , only a few weeks ago , had been frantically trying to find a bottle of wine in their kitchen to serve to a surprise house guest , helle thorning-schmidt , who just happens to be the prime minister of denmark ( as well as the wife of labour parliamentary candidate stephen kinnock , son of neil ) .
`` it was more fawlty towers than borgen , '' she deadpanned .

members of the audience , which included actor ross kemp , tv presenter fiona phillips and hollywood director paul greengrass , later described her address - delivered , like a true miliband , without notes - as `` inspirational '' , '' from the heart '' and `` pack [ ing ] a punch '' .. james kirkup at the telegraph says lib dem supporters are likely to have more gay friends than supporters of other parties .
lib dems have the most gay friends and acquaintances , while ukip supporters have fewest .
so perhaps - and i stress perhaps - gay friends are a possible indicator of voting intention : the more you have , the more likely you are to vote lib dem .
and the fewer you have , the more likely you are to go ukip .
this raises some questions , questions to which i offer no answers .
are gay friends just a correlate of voting intention ?
or is there a causal relationship here ?
does knowing gay people make a person more likely to vote lib dem ?
or inversely , does voting lib dem make you more likely to know gay people ?
likewise , does a lack of gay friends lead people to vote ukip ?
and does voting ukip make gay people less likely to be your friend ?

the second observation about those charts is that there is very little difference in the social connections of conservative and labour voters , whose gay friendships are broadly similar to each other , and the population as a whole .
earlier this week the daily mail 's sebastian shakespeare reported that selina scott was considering becoming a conservative mp .
he said she could stand in thirsk and malton , where anne mcintosh is standing down .
but today scott has put out a statement saying she was not interested in being conservative mp for thirsk and malton .
but she has not ruled out trying to stand somewhere else .
here 's the statement .
this has been a very difficult decision for me and i would like to thank all of those who urged me to stand .
for some time i have been convinced that if i was to be elected to parliament i could make a significant difference for the people who live in thirsk and malton , where i also live and know well .
i am intimately involved in the life and issues of the constituency and have fought for its wellbeing over several contentious issues .

these battles have led me to take a jaundiced view of much of the political landscape which i do not believe serves the public well and which , more importantly , from my conversations the public does not believe serves them well also . ''
thirsk and malton is one of the most scenically beautiful constituencies in the country but it also has unacceptable levels of rural poverty .

after approaches to put my name forward for the vacant seat of thirsk and malton following the de-selection of the sitting conservative mp , i had considered my position and my political allegiances .
i also considered standing as an independent so that i would not be tied to party politics .

this decision not to put my name forward for thirsk and malton at this time will not prevent me offering my services to constituencies in the future should i decide to become involved at next may 's general election . ''
selina scott hordle/rex

documents.title: lunchtime summary
text: philip hammond , the foreign secretary , has backed attempts to broker a ceasefire between israel and hamas following talks with the israeli prime minister , binyamin netanyahu , and the palestinian president , mahmoud abbas..

the green party has called for a wealth tax of up to 2 % on the assets of multimillionaires that it believes could raise more than £ 40bn a year.. david ruffley , a conservative mp , has issued a public apology for the first time for assaulting his partner .

as guido fawkes reports , the matter is now being investigated by michael gove , the new chief whip.. ed balls , the shadow chancellor , has defended his decision to get rid of sharon shoesmith as head of children 's services at haringey council when the was children 's secretary in the last government .
this week it was revealed that shoesmith had received more than £ 600,000 for unfair dismissal .
speaking on radio 2 's jeremy vine show , balls said he acted correctly .
i did n't rush to a judgement ; i asked the independent inspectors to tell me the truth .
they came to me and said 'the position is devastatingly bad , and it starts at the top with a failure of leadership ' .
that was sharon shoesmith 's failure of leadership .
i could not have kept her in her statutory post and kept public confidence .

i did what i thought was the only thing possible to maintain public confidence and allow social workers in haringey and across the country to get on and do their job of keeping children safe.. sir tony brenton , britain 's former ambassador to moscow , has said the government 's decision to order a public inquiry into the death of alexander litvinenko will damage relations with russia .

speaking to a lords committee he said : the huge problem we had when i was there was the murder of alexander litvinenko , which meant that everything was frozen by the end of my time there and we 're still living with the aftermath of that ; there are still sanctions in place and of course the public inquiry has just been announced , which is just going to make things worse again .
in glasgow david cameron has been watching some of the men 's sprint qualifying heats on the first day of the commonwealth games , according to the press association .
he said he felt qualified to support all the home teams .
i 'm a firm believer that as a cameron who lives in england with a welsh grandmother , who 's probably got a bit of irish blood in there somewhere , i can support all the home nations .

the home office has published the terms of reference of the review peter wanless will carry out into the 114 missing files relating to paedophile allegations , and into how the home office originally investigated this matter .
you can read all today 's guardian politics stories here .
and all the politics stories filed yesterday , including some in today 's paper , are here .
as for the rest of the papers , here 's the politicshome list of top 10 must-reads , and here 's the conservativehome round-up of political stories in today 's papers .

and here are three articles i found particularly interesting.. james chapman in the daily mail says david cameron is set to create more peers , taking the number of people in the house of lords over 1,000 .
david cameron is set to pack the house of lords with more cronies and failed politicians despite warnings the number of peers is set to top 1,000 .

constitutional experts have warned that handing dozens of political allies and donors is 'unsustainable ' , but government sources said another list of appointments to the bloated second chamber is due within the next fortnight the list of around 20 new peers is expected to contain at least one conservative party donor and around three labour nominees .

former energy minister greg barker , an old ally of the prime minister , is among those tipped to enter the lords - though not until the time of the next general election david willetts , the former universities and science minister , is thought to be another leading candidate to be handed a peerage when he too steps down at the next election.. chris greenwood in the daily mail says lords condon and blair , both former metropolitan police commissioners , have angered officers by opposing mandatory life sentences for people who kill police officers.. tim montgomerie in the times ( paywall ) says david cameron was let down by his pollsters in the past .
i do blame agenda-based opinion polling for many of the failures of the cameron years .
although the research being put on mr cameron 's desk was conducted according to high industry standards , it did n't tell the whole story .
much of the polling conducted for him was produced by people who were ideologically ill-disposed to traditionalist conservative views on europe , the family and tax .
they never went the extra mile to understand how tax cuts could best be sold to voters .
they never properly investigated the early signs of discontent on the right that culminated in the haemorrhage of tory voters to ukip .
the pollsters were infected with the same disposition that affected the whole early cameron operation
michael fallon , the new defence secretary , has launched britain 's first armed forces muslim forum .
according to the ministry of defence , it will `` encourage better dialogue and help highlight the crucial role british muslims play in our armed forces both past and present . ''

documents.title: ukip reshuffle
text: the ukip reshuffle continues .
this is from the ukip leader nigel farage .
nigel farage ( @ nigel farage ) i have today announced four new appointments to ukip 's frontbench # ukipshuffle i must say , until today i did n't realise ukip had a frontbench .
it 's a term normally applied to the house of commons , where frontbenchers are mps who sit on the frontbench because they are ministers or shadow ministers .
ukip , of course , does not have any mps , although it does have 24 meps .
still , you know what farage means .
here 's an extract from the news release .
north west mep paul nuttall will continue to serve as deputy leader whilst also taking on the portfolio for education , skills & training .
newly-elected mep louise bours will be taking on the role of health spokesman .
yorkshire mep mike hookem , who has served in the raf and as a reservist for the commando engineers , will be ukip 's defence spokesman .
and mep for the west midlands jill seymour will be taking on the role of transport spokesman .
these four appointments join yesterday 's news that patrick o'flynn will be ukip 's economic spokesman , with steven woolfe taking on the portfolios of immigration and financial affairs .

documents.title: green party calls for a £ 21bn wealth tax on wealthiest 1 %
text: natalie bennett lee www.sarahmlee .
the green party is calling for a wealth tax on the richest 1 % , which it says broadly equates to those with household wealth of £ 3m or more .
it is proposing taxing this at the rate of 1 % , which it says would raise £ 21bn a year .
or , at least that is what the party says on the press notice on its website .

in the press notice that the party sent our earlier by email , and in the briefing note about the policy , the greens said that the tax could either be levied at 1 % , raising £ 21bn , or 2 % , raising £ 43bn .
here 's what the briefing note says .
we favour a 1 % or 2 % tax on household assets of £ 3m and above .
this would raise approximately £ 21bn to £ 43bn a year .
a household with assets of £ 3m would pay between £ 30,000 and £ 60,000 a year as a result of our wealth tax .
most people with assets at this level will have sufficient income to pay the wealth tax from their current income .
a very few people will have perhaps a very low income and a single rather illiquid asset , such as a house .
arrangements could be made in such cases to pay any accumulated wealth tax when the house is eventually sold , usually on the death of the owner .
the party says that wealth covers property , financial assets like shares , physical assets and pension funds .
countries like france , spain , iceland , the netherlands , norway and switzerland all have wealth taxes , it says .
in the briefing note , the party says that it considered proposing a wealth tax on the wealthiest 10 % , but ruled this out .
if the wealth tax applied to all of the top 10 % , as has been suggested elsewhere , we would need to tax people whose assets exceed around £ 1m .
this would be about 3m people , and for many of them their £ 1m wealth is no more than a medium-sized house in london and two ty professional pension pots .
we think it is fairer to target the super-wealthy and apply the tax to the top 1 % - households that have assets of over £ 3m - around 300,000 people .
in a statement , natalie bennett , the green party leader , says the wealth tax proposal shows that party is committed to delivering fundamental change .
our strong general election polling and surge in membership goes to show that the green party 's commitment to people over profits policies are really hitting home .
the green party is prepared to take principled stands and an increasing number of voters recognise and value this .

other political parties are offering business as usual , only minor changes to our failed economic system and policies that are helping the super-rich and making the poor pay for the economic crisis that they did not create .
a wealth tax is part of the green party 's policy programme that will deliver real change for the common good .
it is this change that british politics and british society desperately needs .
for the record , here are today 's yougov gb polling figures .

labour : 38 % ( up 1 point from yougov yesterday ) conservatives : 34 % ( no change ) ukip : 12 % ( down 2 ) lib dems : 8 % ( up 1 ) labour lead : 4 points ( up 1 ) government approval : -24 ( down 3 ) according to electoral calculus , this would give labour a majority of 50 .

hammond in jerusalem says britain supports israel 's right to defend itself philip hammond at a press conference in jerusalem photograph : /bbc news philip hammond , the new foreign secretary , is in jerusalem for talks with the israelie prime minister , binyamin netanyahu .
the two men have just addressed the media together .
netanyahu said he was grateful for britain 's support .
and hammond said britain defended israel 's right to defend itself .

i 'm pleased to be here so early in my tenure as british foreign secretary and i 'm here because the uk , along with the rest of the international community , is determined to do everything that it can to help to bring this current conflict to a quick end .

britain has been very clear - i have been very clear , prime minister cameron has been very clear , that this current cycle of violence was triggered by hamas firing hundreds of rockets at israeli towns and cities indiscriminately and in breach of international humanitarian law .
britain has also been very clear that israel has the right to defend itself and its citizens .
we are gravely concerned by the ongoing heavy level of civilian casualties .
we want to see a ceasefire quickly agreed .
we welcomed the earlier ceasefire proposals and we were grateful to you , prime minister , for your immediate agreement to it .
we are disappointed that hamas has apparently once again rejected ceasefire proposals .
my colleague alexandra topping is covering the events in gaza in detail on our gaza crisis live blog .

according to the ipswich star , david ruffley 's decision to issue a statement was prompted by a letter he received last week from the very rev frances ward , the dean of st edmundsbury cathedral , telling him his position was `` untenable '' .
the letter was subsequently published in full on the guido fawkes website .
david ruffley , the conservative mp who faces a battle to keep his seat after accepting a police caution for assaulting his partner , has not spoken about the incident until now .
but today he has issued a statement through his lawyers .

here it is in full in march this year , an incident occurred between me and my former partner , resulting in inappropriate action on my part , which i deeply regret , in respect of which i accepted a police caution for common assault .
some time later , i telephoned my former partner to apologise .
i am pleased to be able to say that she has accepted my apology .
i have refrained from making any public statement on this matter as it is a deeply personal matter .
it is my understanding that my former partner wishes the incident to remain private .
i wish to stress that i would never condone domestic violence under any circumstances .
the incident was dealt with by the police and i accepted responsibility for my actions at the time .
i regret this matter in its entirety and the position in which i put my former partner and i now ask that her privacy be respected .
if there is any more on this today , i 'll cover it .
otherwise , it seems relatively quiet .
but we will probably hear a lot from scotland .
david cameron and nick clegg are both there today , and vince cable , the business secretary , is there too , giving a speech in glasgow .

as usual , i will also be flagging up any breaking political news , posting summaries with a round-up of all the day 's developments , and highlighting the most interesting political articles on the web .
if you want to follow me on twitter , i 'm on @ twitterid .
